top_comment.text:
My question how in the hell did HBO and Vice get permission to visit North 
Korea yet there is a vice documentary about the owner or something like 
that taking 3 years just to get access to North Korea﻿
top_comment.author: Jack Craig

comments.text: I took me one month to get a visa
comments.author: KLOI ヤクザ

comments.text:
Only Vice went to North Korea. Well along with the 3 globetrotters. HBO 
didn't go, Vice just shows their documentary on their channel.
comments.author: Logan Taylor

comments.text:
+Karl Logan North Korea lets in who it *wants* to let in.  Christopher 
Hitchens had to use a fake I.D. to travel there, for example.  The limiting 
factor here seems to be the N. Korean government and very little else.
comments.author: Alek Miller

comments.text:
Actually N.Korea is fairly open to visitors who want to come and visit on 
guided tours. Vice tried to hype it up as some kind of untouchable thing a 
few years back because vice is a tabloid. But the BBC has done loads of 
documentaries inside north korea and I know people who have visited without 
any issue.

captions.text:
Hey, Moose, I got
this for you.

RYAN DUFFY: You were
thirsty, right?

ALEX "MOOSE" WEEKES:
Yeah, I think I'll

RYAN DUFFY: You wouldn't want
to be rude, though?
You would have to try that.

ALEX "MOOSE" WEEKES: You chewing
or you drinkin'?

RYAN DUFFY: Guys, please
have a seat.

If you guys want to join us,
that would be great.

How was it playing in the game
with the Harlem Globetrotters

RYAN DUFFY: Do you remember
how you did?

Any particular highlights
from the game?

hit a three.

I thought about taking
a three.

Then I thought about 10,000
people watching, and I didn't

have Bull, before he leaves,

jumps up on the rim, and kicks

because the Marshall came in,

and I didn't know that
he was coming.

Did that change anything
for you?

RYAN DUFFY: You think it's a
good thing to have foreign

visitors come in and interact
with the people, and provide

Do you think maybe that kind

title: Basketball Diplomacy: Lunch with the North Korean Team (VICE on HBO Ep. #10 Extended)
